title.narrative: Extractive Industries Technical Assistance Project Phase 2

description.narrative: The proposed project development objective is to strengthen governance, knowledge, and sustainability of the extractives sector in Sierra Leone.

Ministry of Mines and Mineral Resources

condition.narrative: Schedule 2, Section IV (A) Not later than four (4) months from the Effective Date, the Recipient shall ensure that the PIU financeteam obtains a refresher course on the financial management and disbursement procedures satisfactory to the World Bank.
Schedule 2, Section IV (B) Not later that one (1) month after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall input all the relevantProject codes into the accounting software for the Project.

Schedule 2, Section IV (C) Not later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall update the SESA to providefor the expanded activities under the Project, in a manner satisfactory to the Association.

title.narrative: Implement the Green Gold Pilot - Develop and implement the Green Gold branding campaign
Strengthen MMMR in policy making (number of people attending policy training per year).
Implement the Green Gold Pilot - Gold miners trained on cleaner technologies
Attract private sector investment - Conduct investment promotion at international conferences
Attract private sector investment - Issue exploration licenses
Implement the Green Gold Pilot - Complete study on green gold value chain
Complete baseline study of artisanal mining
Citizen engagement Sensitization ahead of fly-overs
Citizen engagement - Components A and C - Nationwide consultations on new policies
Complete new and/or revised maps at 1:100.000 scale
Implement the Policy Actions Matrix of the Minerals Policy
Complete a nationwide airborne geophysical study
